attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Describes the role(s) the current element plays in the context of the document.

attributes.name: aria-atomic
attributes.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

attributes.name: aria-braillelabel
attributes.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element, which is intended to be converted into Braille. See related aria-label.

attributes.name: aria-brailleroledescription
attributes.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized abbreviated description for the role of an element, which is intended to be converted into Braille. See related aria-roledescription.

attributes.name: aria-busy
attributes.description: Indicates an element is being modified and that assistive technologies could wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.

attributes.name: aria-controls
attributes.description: Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element. See related aria-owns.

attributes.name: aria-current
attributes.description: Indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

attributes.name: aria-describedby
attributes.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object. See related aria-labelledby and aria-description.

attributes.name: aria-description
attributes.description: Defines a string value that describes or annotates the current element. See related aria-describedby.

attributes.name: aria-details
attributes.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that provide additional information related to the object. See related aria-describedby.

attributes.name: aria-disabled
attributes.description: Indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable. See related aria-hidden and aria-readonly.

attributes.name: aria-dropeffect
attributes.description: [Deprecated in ARIA 1.1] Indicates what functions can be performed when a dragged object is released on the drop target.

attributes.name: aria-errormessage
attributes.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that provides an error message for an object. See related aria-invalid and aria-describedby.

attributes.name: aria-flowto
attributes.description: Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion, allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order.

attributes.name: aria-grabbed
attributes.description: [Deprecated in ARIA 1.1] Indicates an element's "grabbed" state in a drag-and-drop operation.

attributes.name: aria-haspopup
attributes.description: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

attributes.name: aria-hidden
attributes.description: Indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API. See related aria-disabled.

attributes.name: aria-invalid
attributes.description: Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application. See related aria-errormessage.

attributes.name: aria-keyshortcuts
attributes.description: Defines keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.

attributes.name: aria-label
attributes.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element. See related aria-labelledby.

attributes.name: aria-labelledby
attributes.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element. See related aria-label and aria-describedby.

attributes.name: aria-live
attributes.description: Indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

attributes.name: aria-owns
attributes.description: Identifies an element (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child relationship between DOM elements where the DOM hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship. See related aria-controls.

attributes.name: aria-posinset
attributes.description: Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM. See related aria-setsize.

attributes.name: aria-relevant
attributes.description: Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified. See related aria-atomic.

attributes.name: aria-roledescription
attributes.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.

attributes.name: aria-setsize
attributes.description: Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM. See related aria-posinset.
